form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cassidy (for himself and Ms. Hassan) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase the age threshold for eligibility for child’s insurance benefits on the basis of disability.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fairness for Disabled Young Adults Act.

section.header: Increase to age threshold for child’s insurance benefits on the basis of disability

subsection.text: Section 202(d) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 402(d)) is amended by striking age of 22 each place it appears and inserting age of 26.

paragraph.text: Section 205(j)(2)(C)(vi)(II)(cc) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 405(j)(2)(C)(vi)(II)(cc)) is amended by striking age of 22 and inserting age of 26.
Section 225(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 425(a)) is amended by striking age of 22 and inserting age of 26.
Section 1631(a)(2)(B)(xvii)(II)(cc) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1383(a)(2)(B)(xvii)(II)(cc)) is amended by striking age of 22 and inserting age of 26.
Section 1634(c) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1383c(c)) is amended by striking age of 22 and inserting age of 26.
